title: CodeTyper
description: A minimalistic website to practice your typing speed while writing code. It functions by fetching a random file from github in the designed repo and language. The project includes a reactive graph, reactive wpm, settings and much more.

title: Crypto Prices
description: A simple extension that lets you easily check crypto prices. It features a 7-day price graph and search. It is available for [chromium](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/crypto-prices/aijcmfbomlkfaclgjpphidgoijibeobj) and [firefox](https://https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/cryptoprices/).

title: Canvas+
description: A free Browser extension that improves the experience of students using Canvas. Everything you could need, from color themes, to navigation shortcuts, to improved performance.

title: Android & Expo
description: I have some experience with Android, Java and Expo from making android apps for school projects.

title: Blog
description: The website that you are viewing right now. It showcases my projects and is used to document my work. It was originally made with astro, express and firebase, until I decided on solidJS and pocketbase.

title: Old Blog
description: My old blog was a simple NextJS website hosted on github pages, it was my first time using react and NextJS and I learned a lot from it.

title: Python
description: I have worked with python in the past for school projects and some personal projects when I had just begun coding. I mainly made simple text games and art with python turtle.

title: Encryptor
description: Encryptor is a small electron app that I made to encrypt and decrypt files. It uses AES-256 encryption and hashing with sha-256. I probably won't be releasing it, because while it works well it isn't up to my standerds in terms of design and features.

title: C Sharp
description: I know very basic C# from messing around with it to make simple guis and manipulating the cursor. I may mess around with it more in the future.

title: Cyberpatriots
description: I mainly work on the ubuntu image for my cyberpatriots team, but also help with forensics on the windows images. I have made some private scripts to search for unwanted files in bash and powershell.
